paper_abstract: There have been various methods to prevent DPA (Differential Power Analysis) on elliptic curve crypto'systems. As for the curves with efficient endomorphisms, Hasan suggested several countermeasures on anomalous binary curves, and Ciet, Quisquater and Sica proposed a countermeasure on CLV curves. Ciet et al.'s method is based on random decomposition of a scalar, and it is a two-dimensional generalization of Coron's method, Hasan's and Ciet et al.'s countermeasures are applied only to a small class of elliptic curves. In this paper, we enlarge the class of DPA-resistant curves by proposing a DPA countermeasure applicable to any curve where the M-obenius expansion method can be used. Our analysis shows that our countermeasure can produce a probability of collision around O(2 -20) with only 15.4-34.0% extra computation for scalar multiplications on various practical settings.
paper_title: A DPA countermeasure by randomized Frobenius decomposition
